channel.title: BATCH help. Need a batch wizard
channel.description:
OK I need to know one thing.
1 ) How can I encypted a variable. I'll show you what i mean;
[code] :y set /p password=Password for members?: if %password%==ticking goto member if not %password%==ticking goto declined [/code] I've typed it so that it says that if the user inputs 'ticking', then it will continue the program, else, it will go to :declined and say that's not the password yadder yadder yadder.
How can i make it so that 'ticking' is encrypted when people right-click and edit the program. Otherwise, they can just see the password. Or, how can I make it so that it creates a .txt file when the program starts that is enrcypted and the program then refers to this file to get the password.
Any idea's?
Syrillia

item.title: BATCH help. Need a batch wizard
item.dc:creator: @A.E.M A.E.M.
item.description:
@A.E.M wrote:

:y
set /p password=Password for members?:
if %password%==ticking goto member
goto declined

there that will make it so if its not the right one it will go to end but i dont know how to make encrypted passwords heres mine

:password
echo Type the password
set /p password=Password:
if %password%==gsxr1000 goto menu
goto error3
:error3
cls
echo Please type the correct password
set /p weeeee=Password:
if %weeeee%==gsxr1000 goto menu ESLE FALSE goto error4
:error4
cls
echo Please type the correct password this is your last try
set /p weeeee=Password:
if %weeeee%==gsxr1000 goto menu ESLE FALSE goto error5
:error5
echo Wrong 
set /p enter=Please Press E then ENTER button on your keyboard to continue
if %enter%==e goto exit
if %enter%==E goto exit
:exit
exit

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Syrillia Syrillia
item.description:
@Syrillia wrote:

A compiler that works with JDK 6.0 + 6.0.1 + 6.0.2.
All you have to do is drop it into the folder and it works. I said posh because most of the script is just making it look good. I’m putting it in the downloads section in a minute with some screenies. Check it out. It’s mainly for people who are making a source, it looks more attractive.

item.title: BATCH help. Need a batch wizard
item.dc:creator: @dog_eats_dog dog eats dog
item.description:
@dog_eats_dog wrote:

Im Not sure if this will work but ill Give a crack at it.

Make a fresh .txt file and Input this into it

@echo off
cls
set /p option=Password:
pause
if %option%==(password here)
:(passwordhere)
start (The .bat File you want to pop up)

Example

@echo off
cls
set /p option=Password:
pause
if %option%==(ownage)
:(ownage)
start (Thebest.bat)

Make sure you put them in the same folder tho or else it will be tricky for the command to pop up your file.

I think thats what you mean anyway, If not sorry

Read full topic

item.title: BATCH help. Need a batch wizard
item.dc:creator: @Syrillia Syrillia
item.description:
@Syrillia wrote:

OK I need to know one thing.

1 ) How can I encypted a variable. I’ll show you what i mean;

	:y
	set /p password=Password for members?:
	if %password%==ticking goto member
	if not %password%==ticking goto declined

I’ve typed it so that it says that if the user inputs ‘ticking’, then it will continue the program, else, it will go to :declined and say that’s not the password yadder yadder yadder.

How can i make it so that ‘ticking’ is encrypted when people right-click and edit the program. Otherwise, they can just see the password. Or, how can I make it so that it creates a .txt file when the program starts that is enrcypted and the program then refers to this file to get the password.

Any idea’s?

Syrillia
